author: profd2004
title: Simple fund management DAO SDK
description: Les SDK qui permettent aux constructeurs de créer facilement des outils et des solutions de qualité sont encore limités.

f6_assessments.q0:
In my opinion this proposal is within the challenge goal, because could improve the software developing typescript SDK and creating a fund management DAO. At the same time I think is more related about business (virtual economy)  and related services.
This proposal is well written and clearly demonstrate  the experience and the team's commitment, guarantees solidity in deliverables, support transparency and accountability for all Cardano community.
The proposal clearly articulates the contest, the problem (new developer ecosystem to write and test smart contracts) and how it will add value to the Cardano governance ecosystem and for all of the stakeholders.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer owner (lidonation.com) is very well skilled about the whole context of the proposal, but it's seems that he doesn't evalue very well the context and the impact for the realization.
The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones, but no  KPI metrics are shown. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and coherent budget with this challenge. I miss in this area that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and market competitor.
f6_assessments.q2: I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. difficulties in adoption of the tools/SDK…) The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and coherent budget with this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Lidonation wants to create an opensource SDK to manage funds for DAOs. This could improve the adaption and creation of new DAOs in general. But it's not really described how it will help to make Cardano the go-to-blockchain for DAOs, which is the goal of this challenge. Of course this project is well-needed in will have a positive impact in general. But more information about the value for Cardano would increase the rating for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has already proven is capability of creating value in the Cardano ecosystem. But the proposer provides only a rough plan for the development. The budget explanation is provided but not described in detail. More details about the technical implementation could have been provided to understand the scope of this proposal better. I miss in this area that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and market competitors. There are similar initiatives and also proposals. What be good to know the different approaches and how synergies could be used.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides only a rough plan for the development. Milestones and a time horizon are defined but remain very general. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful adoption. No metrics or KPIs are set to measure the success of this proposal. Also the team doesn't offer a documentation source to see and track the progress of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to create an SDK to make it easier for people to build simple fund management DAOs.  The problem is nicely motivated by explaining the current manual process used by the Stake Pool with which one or both proposers are associated, which allocates 50% of its margin to mint a coin that is used to enable delegators to vote for which charity will receive these funds.  As someone who would like to contribute more to charity, and would love to participate with others in identifying worthy charities, but doubts the trustworthiness of existing centralized or manual processes, I think it is an excellent idea to enable more entities to support this kind of charitable giving.  The proposal would develop an SDK to enable making this process trustworthy via smart contracts. It is nice that the proposal makes clear that the SDK would be available in open source, so I think the proposal clearly fits the Challenge goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea is nicely explained.  However, the roadmap lacks much detail, basically amounting to seeing what's out there, adopting a solution if a suitable one is found, or building in case it is not.  There are no milestones or deliverables listed.  The bulk of the budget appears to be for the proposers' research and development work.  The project appears to depend on recruiting Plutus developers to work on a solution if a suitable one is not found in open source.  In my opinion, the proposal would be better placed if some of this initial research had been done already, enabling the proposal to be more specific about what will be done (use existing or build a solution), which in turn would make it easier to provide more detailed milestones, deliverables, and more clarity around the Budget and how it will be used.
f6_assessments.q2: Again, there is a lack of milestones and deliverables against which progress can be monitored, and there is no mention of any periodic updates or reports that would enable people to monitor activity such as research to look for suitable solutions in open source.

f6_assessments.q0:
This SDKs is directly meet what Cardano ecosystem needs for developing its inside governance model now and then, and it also meets the challenge brief. This team will help to solve it by building contracts that can enable some features inside the proposal. This idea will help hundreds to thousands of projects in Cardano ecosystem to save time and money when applying DAO in their system/ services. 
The idea is necessary but the team should give us some info about how they led their idea to make an impact in the Cardano ecosystem, moreover, some key metrics to show that how the team is concerned about the info this challenge gives, is it aligns with what it given. And so on, this will help their idea be funded.
f6_assessments.q1:
Just vision and features are not enough for assessing the feasibility. For better rates, the team should provide more detailed roadmap instead of outlines of 1 month, 3 month, 6 month. This is hard to everyone to assess. Also, when detailing more their implementation plan the team can have a good sense of a lot of potential problem/challenges in the implementation plan then gets rid of them - things that they need to include in the proposal but not yet there. 
The only good content for assessing the feasibility of their plan in this proposal is the detailed technical explanation about the feature in their solution will make
f6_assessments.q2:
Their included roadmap is too short to audit the project if the team wants to be funded they should breakdown detail the activities that they will do in every single period, and it better is attaching some related goals. 
Key metrics/ KPIs are also the key things that not only help audit the project but also help everyone look at the proposal can understand where the team wants their idea to go and which vision they want to get. It's like the detailed explanation of their solution above, that clarify for their big idea and can address the problem. Therefore, we can see how it will impact the ecosystem if it succeeds.

solution: Un SDK typographique opensource auto-hébergé ou alimenté par Dandelion pour créer une DAO de gestion de fonds. Des règles DSL qui régissent les entrées et sorties d'argent.
experience: 14+ Yrs Software & Cloud Engineering, développement Blockchain, conseil aux entreprises, langues du monde, rédaction technique, enseignement.
